p: It is known that there are some modifications to the adenosine scaffold that increase A 3 binding affinity and selectivity among adenosine agonists: a 5′-uronamide moiety (as in Compound 37, Table 5) and N 6 -positions (as in Compound 38, Table 5) [ 84]. In the 3′-amino series, the most potent compound also exhibited 300-fold selectivity over the A 1 adenosine receptor.
